alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 09 at 2:33PM PDT until April 11 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM SUNDAY TO 11 PM PDT MONDAY ABOVE 2500 FEET... * WHAT...Accumulating snow above 2500 feet expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches with some of the higher elevations seeing up to 18 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Portions of the Coast Range, Kalmiopsis, Umpqua Divide and the Cascade Foothills. Although below 2500 feet, this does include Canyon Creek Pass on Interstate 5, Bear Camp Road, Prospect, and the Ashland Watershed. * WHEN...From 5 PM Sunday to 11 PM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Although Sexton Mountain Pass, Ashland, and Siskiyou Summit are not in the advisories, expect gusty winds and some accumulating snows to occur. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Central Douglas County; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; Jackson County
